name: Mercure Swansea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel on the northern outskirts of Swansea. Over looks lake.
reviews.title: Lakeside Hotel

reviews.text: Located on a new industrial/retail park with car dealerships etc.
reviews.title: ... Going the extra mile!
Average
reviews.text: Close to Tesco and Morrisons just down the road.

reviews.title: Adequate if you get a good deal
reviews.text: Recommend the small heated pool which we used every morning before breakfast which you have virtually to yourselves. Rooms nice and quiet. Breakfast we found expensive so we ate at Tesco or Frankie and Bennys in Swansea (park your car in Sainsbury's car park - free 2 hours)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was friendly and check in fairly efficient, After checking in as I was gathering up my bags she handed me the key folder, I couldn't read the number without getting my glasses out of my bag again and asked what room I was in - she would not tell me!. She said she was not allowed to tell me the number out loud ? Thank fully my partner arrived or I would have had to ask someone else to save me rummaging in my bag. It was inconvenient for me but she made an assumption about literacy - what if someone could not read it ?
reviews.title: Its Ok .. I would not stay again

reviews.text: There is no lift but it is only 2 floors and she did ask if I could manage the bags so I assume help would be available if needed. The room was clean and a good size, although the hotel was pretty full other than the party people in the room across being noisy coming and going I did not hear any other room noise which is good. The bed was firm
reviews.title: Well run hotel.

reviews.text: The bathroom has tacky plastic green paneling and its a bit dark but it looks like all the sealant had been recently re done so very clean, nice size bath.
reviews.title: One night's stay - try harder

reviews.text: I don't have feather pillows and the 2 that were there were pretty flat, I requested 2 firm non feather pillows, I had a cold and wanted to be propped up a bit, and what arrived was 2 flat very smelly foam ones, they were really unpleasant. I took them to Reception and they said the smell was their fabric conditioner , I was surprised as the rest of the bedding was clean and fresh. I requested that they be changed and that we get a second set of towels as there is only one in the room. We were then told that a second set should be in a plastic bag in the wardrobe - they were :(
reviews.title: Clean and pleasant enough hotel away from the city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we picked up the replacement pillows they were identical (the same ones) to the first flat and smelly . The reception patrionising and not helpful and said I could speak to the duty manager but it would not make a difference. I put them in a corner of the room and wrapped the towel from the plastic bag around the feather ones.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but avoid eating here

reviews.text: Staff are very nice but this hotel has not improved sufficiently from the days when it was the Ramada Jarvis. Carpets and fixtures are tired, breakfast isn't great and the building itself is just grim. Bed was comfortable but no air-con and the floors creak like mad. Very expensive for such an average room.
reviews.title: Not up to usual Mercure standard

reviews.text: This was a relaxed but nice hotel that was clean and efficient. Nice staff that were helpful but not overbearing.
reviews.title: Nice out of town hotel

reviews.text: My husband and I had a good time here. Even though no a/c we were supplied with a fan which was very necessary in the extreme heat.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel and only 2 minutes drive from big tesco extra.Helpfull staff.Swiming pool too small(you can't swim there).Bathroom wasn't clean perfect. There are so much rooms and you can feel lost.Close to nice lake.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: 1st room was stuffy. Mould on bathroom ceiling.asked for move. All the free rooms were worse . Moved to room on lakeside (although concealed by bushes)tge folliwibg midday but wasted all morning hanging about. New room better as was fresher smelling. All decor is old and beige., so dont believe booking.com photos , they're 10 years out of date. Bathrooms have old style metal baths and water temperature variable.
reviews.title: Run down motel style place mainly used by footballers.

description: Hotel (Licensed) with 50+ letting rooms in city location. With car parking. Smoking in designated areas. Casual dress for meals. Vegetarians, Children, Special Diets, Organic Products catered for. Eating outside is possible.
